intro: Hibbertia virgata, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Hibbertia virgata is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It is an important component of the local flora and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
